Diabetic Chicken Parmesan

Diabetic Chicken Parmesan: A Healthy Twist on a Classic Dish

If you're a fan of Italian cuisine, you've probably indulged in a plate of delicious Chicken Parmesan at some point. However, if you're living with diabetes, you may be concerned about the high carbohydrate and sugar content typically found in this dish. But fear not! With a few simple modifications, you can enjoy a diabetic-friendly version of Chicken Parmesan without compromising on taste.

Firstly, let's talk about the breading. Traditional Chicken Parmesan is coated in breadcrumbs, which can be high in carbs. Instead, opt for a healthier alternative by using almond flour or crushed pork rinds. These options are low in carbs and provide a satisfying crunch to your chicken.

Next, let's address the sauce. Many store-bought marinara sauces are loaded with added sugars. To avoid this, make your own sauce using fresh tomatoes, garlic, and herbs. This way, you can control the amount of sugar and sodium in your dish.

When it comes to cheese, choose a low-fat mozzarella or a combination of mozzarella and Parmesan. These cheeses still provide that gooey, melty goodness without the excess fat and calories.

Lastly, consider the portion size. Chicken Parmesan is often served with a large portion of pasta, which can cause blood sugar spikes. Instead, pair your chicken with a side of roasted vegetables or a small serving of whole grain pasta or quinoa.

By making these simple adjustments, you can enjoy a diabetic-friendly version of Chicken Parmesan that is both delicious and nutritious. Remember, it's all about balance and moderation. So go ahead, indulge in this Italian classic without worrying about your blood sugar levels. Bon app√©tit!
